content:
Ph.D. (Information Science)
Researcher at Toyota Motor Corporation
Research interests: data mining and machine learning. Feel free to contact me via kotanakm3 [ü¶â] gmail.com (Please replace [ü¶â] with @)
üìù Research My research focuses on large-scale, dynamic, and multi-aspect data, with the goal of designing scalable, adaptive, and relational machine learning systems, thereby extending their applicability across a broader range of complex, real-world scenarios, particularly:
Mining Complex Time-stamped Event Streams Predicting Future Events by Discovering Predictive Patterns Time Series Transformation for Ultrafast Arriving Data Streams Keywords: Data Stream Mining, Tensor Analysis, Probabilistic Generative Model, Time Series Analysis, Information Theory for Model Selection, Multi-objective Optimization.

title: Publications

content:
Mining Complex Time-stamped Event Streams Given a huge, online stream of time-evolving events with multiple attributes, such as online shopping logs: (item, price, brand, time), and local mobility: (pick-up location, drop-off location, time), how can we see any hidden patterns, rules, and anomalies?
Short video Predicting Future Events by Discovering Predictive Patterns Due to the paper being under blind review, identifying information has been concealed. Coming soon! Time Series Transformation for Ultrafast Arriving Data Streams Due to the paper being under blind review, identifying information has been concealed. Coming soon!

Mining Complex Time-stamped Event Streams

Given a huge, online stream of time-evolving events with multiple attributes, such as online shopping logs: (item, price, brand, time), and local mobility: (pick-up location, drop-off location, time), how can we see any hidden patterns, rules, and anomalies?
